conclusion: To determine if displacements are the same, compare areas under velocity-time graphs.
Velocity is on y-axis, time is on x-axis; Car A's graph is decreasing, Car B's is increasing.
Calculate area under Car A's graph by integrating its velocity function over time.
Calculate area under Car B's graph by integrating its velocity function over time.
Displacement of Car A is the area under its curve; displacement of Car B is the area under its curve.
If areas under both curves are equal, displacements are the same.
If shaded regions under curves are equal, displacements are the same; if not, they differ.
Shaded area under Car A's graph is different from Car B's.
Displacements of Car A and Car B are not the same.
